text: Heat up the oil in a large saucepan over medium/low heat and add the onions. Sauté the onions until they have turned golden brown and caramelized. This should take around 30 minutes. Turn the heat to high and had in the chicken thighs (beef, shrimp or tofu). You then need to add carrots and the water. Then cover at leave to boil. Skim of any of the foam or oil that accumulates at the surface. Turn down the heat to medium and add in the potatoes, pureed apple, garam masala and salt. Cover and simmer for around 25-30 minutes until the meat is nice and tender. To make the roux, add flour and butter into a smaller saucepan over a medium/low heat. Keep cooking until the flour turns slightly brown and the mixture smells similar to baking bread. Add in the garam masala and stir. Add in some ground black pepper and cayenne pepper, tomato paste and tonkatsu sauce, then combine them together. Remove from heat and wait until it has cooled.  To make the curry ladle around 2 cups of liquid into the roux and whisk until the mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture back into the other pot and stir until it has thickened. Add in the peas and heat through. Finished.
